sen.j: 結城 直朝（ゆうき なおとも、1325年（正中 (元号)2年）－1343年4月26日（興国4年/康永2年4月2日 (旧暦)））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Naotomo YUKI (1352 - 1343 April 26) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 直朝は父の代に引き続き足利尊氏の北朝 (日本)勢力に与し、南朝方の白河結城氏、小田氏、関氏などと対立した。
sen.e: Naotomo continues to support the Northern Court (Japan) power of Takauji ASHIKAGA after his father, and went against the Shirakawa Yuki clan, Oda clan, and Seki clan of the Southern Court.
Naotomo continued to support the Northern Court (Japan) power of Takauji ASHIKAGA after his father's death, and went against the Shirakawa Yuki clan, Oda clan, and Seki clan of the Southern Court.
sen.cmt: after his father→after his father's deathに変更しました。時制を変更しました。
sen.e: Naotomo continued to support the Northern Court (Japan) power of Takauji ASHIKAGA after his father's death, and went against the Shirakawa Yuki clan, Oda clan, and Seki clan of the Southern Court.

sen.j: 1343年、尊氏の重臣・高師冬に従って南朝 (日本)勢力である北畠親房・関宗祐・関宗政が守る常陸国関城を攻撃し、奮戦して大いなる武功を挙げたが、このときの戦いで重傷を負い、まもなく死去した（坑道を掘って関城を攻略しようとする作戦に参加したが、城兵に看破され敗走する際に討ち取られたとも）。
sen.e: 1343, given the order from KO no Morofuyu, who was the senior vassal for Takauji, he attacked Seki-jo castle in Hitachi Province protected by Chikafusa KITABATAKE, Munesuke SEKI, and Munemasa SEKI of Southern Court (Japan) power, although succeeding his military exploits, he got injured badly from this battle and soon dies afterwards. (It is also said that, while taking part in the plan to dig the tunnel to make their way inside the Seki castle, they were attacked by the castle guards, and was killed when trying to escape).
